brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether birth on a birthing seat will effect numbers of instrumentally assisted vaginal births, vaginal traumas, blood loss,use of artificial oxytocin for labour augmentation and fetal outcomes.

primary_outcome.description: Instrumental births include vacuum extraction and forceps delivery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Administration of oxytocin for augmentation of labor
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During labor and birth up to 36 hours postpartum

secondary_outcome.description: Blood loss postpartum is weighed and measured and maternal hemoglobin levels are registered.
Perineal outcomes include vaginal and perineal traumas, episiotomies and perineal edema.
Fetal outcomes include Apgar scores, cord blood pH levels and admissions to the NICU.

arm_group.description: Randomized to birth on a midwife designed birth seat
Randomized to birth in any other position except on the midwife designed birth seat.

intervention.description: Randomization takes place on admission to the labor ward when the participants are in active labor.Participants in this arm were to sit on the seat for 20 minute periods.After these 20 minutes, the participant should stand and mobilize during two to three contractions, before resuming the birth seat position. If progress of the descent of the fetal head was obvious the participant was not asked to mobilize.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- nulliparous women who understood the Swedish language sufficiently well to receive information and give informed consent
- a normal pregnancy,singleton fetus in cephalic presentation
- spontaneous onset of labor occurring between gestational weeks 37 + 0 and 41 + 6
- Body Mass Index less (BMI) than thirty
- gestational diabetes not requiring medical treatment
- women who were planning a vaginal birth after a caesarean section (VBAC)
- women induced because of spontaneous rupture of membranes with no spontaneous contractions for longer than twenty-four hours
Exclusion Criteria:
- multiparous women
- birth before gestational week 37
- breech presentation
- maternal BMI more than 30
- multiple pregnancy
- infectious disease
- pre-eclampsia or other conditions requiring medical care
